radiographic_examinations.findings: Severe bilateral trichiasis, meibomian gland disease, lid notching, cicatricial ectropion, symblephara, and 360Â° pannus in both corneas with central neovascularization of the left eye. Significant epitheliopathy bilaterally, but no epithelial defect.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Two weeks later, the patient had worsening pain, photophobia, and reduced vision in her left eye with a large descemetocele noted.
